meanings.definition: Marked with short parallel lines to indicate relief on a map.
meanings.sent1: The hachured map showed the mountainous areas clearly.
meanings.sent2: The hachured regions on the map helped us understand the terrain better.
meanings.sent3: The hachured map made the hills look like rows of tiny trees.
meanings.sent4: Her face was a hachured landscape of emotions, each line telling a different story.
meanings.sent5: The hachured areas on the map stood out like bold brushstrokes on a canvas.

meanings.definition: To mark with short parallel lines to indicate relief on a map.
meanings.sent1: He carefully hachured the map to show the changes in elevation.
meanings.sent2: The cartographer hachured the map to highlight the topographical features.
meanings.sent3: She hachured the map with such precision that it looked like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The artist hachured the landscape, creating a visual representation of the terrain.
meanings.sent5: Hachuring the map required a steady hand and attention to detail.
